update.description:
* Fix windows build. [Jenkins build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_math-default-devel-windows7/49/)

* There were inconsistencies in the API, which are now fixed.

* 100% line code coverage!!!

After this pull-request, we will release Version 1.0.0 of ign_math. If you're interested, there is a [branch in gazebo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/branch/ign_math_3.1) that uses ign_math.
update.title: Fix windows build & Fix API

content.raw: This is actually #13, moving discussion there.
content.html: This is actually #13, moving discussion there.

content.raw:
There's some weird failures of the Spline tests on osx:
~~~
[ RUN      ] SplineTest.Spline
/Users/scpeters/ws/ignition/src/ign_math/src/Spline_TEST.cc:42: Failure
Expected: s.UpdatePoint(2, math::Vector3d(2, 2, 2)) throws an exception of type math::IndexException.
  Actual: it throws a different type.
[  FAILED  ] SplineTest.Spline (0 ms)
~~~
Restoring IGNITION_VISIBLE to the IndexException class fixes it:
~~~
diff -r ee8d2607413d include/ignition/math/IndexException.hh
--- a/include/ignition/math/IndexException.hh	Fri Jul 11 10:51:20 2014 -0700
+++ b/include/ignition/math/IndexException.hh	Fri Jul 11 17:07:55 2014 -0700
@@ -27,7 +27,7 @@
     /// \class IndexException IndexException.hh ignition/math/IndexException.hh
     /// \brief Exception that is thrown when an out-of-bounds index is
     /// encountered.
-    class IndexException : public std::runtime_error
+    class IGNITION_VISIBLE IndexException : public std::runtime_error
     {
       public: IndexException() : std::runtime_error("Invalid index")
               {}
~~~
content.html:
There's some weird failures of the Spline tests on osx:

[ RUN      ] SplineTest.Spline
/Users/scpeters/ws/ignition/src/ign_math/src/Spline_TEST.cc:42: Failure
Expected: s.UpdatePoint(2, math::Vector3d(2, 2, 2)) throws an exception of type math::IndexException.
  Actual: it throws a different type.
[  FAILED  ] SplineTest.Spline (0 ms)

Restoring IGNITION_VISIBLE to the IndexException class fixes it:

diff -r ee8d2607413d include/ignition/math/IndexException.hh
--- a/include/ignition/math/IndexException.hh   Fri Jul 11 10:51:20 2014 -0700
+++ b/include/ignition/math/IndexException.hh   Fri Jul 11 17:07:55 2014 -0700
@@ -27,7 +27,7 @@
     /// \class IndexException IndexException.hh ignition/math/IndexException.hh
     /// \brief Exception that is thrown when an out-of-bounds index is
     /// encountered.
-    class IndexException : public std::runtime_error
+    class IGNITION_VISIBLE IndexException : public std::runtime_error
     {
       public: IndexException() : std::runtime_error("Invalid index")
               {}

For the UNIT_Filter_TEST failure on osx, it seems to be related to uninitialized variables. The following patch fixes it. The Set(0.0) is needed to initialize the Filter::y0 variable, which is difficult because it's templated.

diff -r ee8d2607413d include/ignition/math/Filter.hh
--- a/include/ignition/math/Filter.hh   Fri Jul 11 10:51:20 2014 -0700
+++ b/include/ignition/math/Filter.hh   Fri Jul 11 16:49:55 2014 -0700
@@ -212,7 +212,12 @@
       }

       /// \brief Input gain control coefficients.
-      protected: double a0, a1, a2, b0, b1, b2 = 0;
+      protected: double a0 = 0,
+                        a1 = 0,
+                        a2 = 0,
+                        b0 = 0,
+                        b1 = 0,
+                        b2 = 0;

       /// \brief Gain of the feedback coefficients.
       protected: T x1, x2, y1, y2;
diff -r ee8d2607413d src/Filter_TEST.cc
--- a/src/Filter_TEST.cc    Fri Jul 11 10:51:20 2014 -0700
+++ b/src/Filter_TEST.cc    Fri Jul 11 16:49:55 2014 -0700
@@ -73,6 +73,7 @@
 TEST(FilterTest, Biquad)
 {
   math::BiQuad<double> filterA;
+  filterA.Set(0.0);
   EXPECT_NEAR(filterA.Value(), 0.0, 1e-10);
   EXPECT_NEAR(filterA.Process(1.1), 0.0, 1e-10);

   filterA.Fc(0.3, 1.4);

content.raw:
The UNIT_Rand_TEST is failing on osx. It seems that setting the random seed is not giving the expected random number ([src/Rand_TEST.cc:48](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign_math/src/ee8d2607413dfde48e6639bbd2387a7d3cacdcf7/src/Rand_TEST.cc?at=api_updates#cl-48)):
~~~
[ RUN      ] RandTest.Rand
/Users/scpeters/ws/ignition/src/ign_math/src/Rand_TEST.cc:48: Failure
The difference between d and 4.72597 is 9.1128212257392374, which exceeds 1e-5, where
d evaluates to -4.3868512257392371,
4.72597 evaluates to 4.7259700000000002, and
1e-5 evaluates to 1.0000000000000001e-05.
[  FAILED  ] RandTest.Rand (0 ms)
~~~
content.html:
The UNIT_Rand_TEST is failing on osx. It seems that setting the random seed is not giving the expected random number (src/Rand_TEST.cc:48):

[ RUN      ] RandTest.Rand
/Users/scpeters/ws/ignition/src/ign_math/src/Rand_TEST.cc:48: Failure
The difference between d and 4.72597 is 9.1128212257392374, which exceeds 1e-5, where
d evaluates to -4.3868512257392371,
4.72597 evaluates to 4.7259700000000002, and
1e-5 evaluates to 1.0000000000000001e-05.
[  FAILED  ] RandTest.Rand (0 ms)

content.raw: I'm going to spend a short amount of time looking at this after lunch. If I can't figure it out, I'll approve and leave it for the issue tracker.
content.html: I'm going to spend a short amount of time looking at this after lunch. If I can't figure it out, I'll approve and leave it for the issue tracker.

content.raw: It's removed from templates. IGN_VISIBLE is only useful for libraries. gcc is fine with it in templates, but windows throws errors.
content.html: It's removed from templates. IGN_VISIBLE is only useful for libraries. gcc is fine with it in templates, but windows throws errors.

content.html: This might be causing a test failure on osx.

update.description:
* Fix windows build. [Jenkins build](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_math-default-devel-windows7/49/)

* There were inconsistencies in the API, which are now fixed.

* 100% line code coverage!!!

After this pull-request, we will release Version 1.0.0 of ign_math. If you're interested, there is a [branch in gazebo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/branch/ign_math_3.1) that uses ign_math.
update.title: Fix windows build & Fix API

content.raw: Oh, I guess Angle was ok. I'll add `!=` for Line2 class.
content.html: Oh, I guess Angle was ok. I'll add != for Line2 class.

content.raw: The Angle class has `!=` but not `==`. The Line2 and Matrix[34] classes have `==` but not `!=`.
content.html: The Angle class has != but not ==. The Line2 and Matrix[34] classes have == but not !=.
drone.io is happy as of 8998c80b4616
